page.title: 04WADDINGTON COUNCIL POLICY
page.content: The Council is to carry out improvements to the toilets at the Village Hall costing Â£1,100.The erection of playground equipment and the painting of existing equipment will cost Â£850. The drive to Redwood Drive Community Centre is to be kerbed and re-surfaced costing Â£4,000 and the Sidney Hall Playing Field is to be drained at a cost of Â£2,500. A higher standard of maintenance of the burial ground is being under-taken this year. 200 trees are to be planted in Somerton Gate Lane. The withdrawal of subsidised school bus services is one problem the Council is fighting the County Education Committee. The route over which children walk when not using the bus is dangerous both from traffic and the danger of attack. The local MP is backing the Council's case.
